intro: Leucopogon shuttleworthii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in coastal and wetland habitats, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
